intro: Erodium petraeum proles cheilanthifolium, commonly known as the rock erodium, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and rocky environments. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in crevices and on rocky soils, demonstrating a high degree of adaptability to harsh conditions. Its seed pods are usually hairy and contain several small, kidney-shaped seeds. This species is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates, where it contributes to the ecological stability of its habitat.
